abstract: Mohammed Zaman, owner of Indian Garden restaurant, North Yorkshire, England, is sentenced to six years in prison after being found guilty of manslaughter by gross negligence, and other offenses, in 2014 death of customer Paul Wilson; Wilson had severe peanut allergy and specifically asked for 'no nuts' in his order.
lead_paragraph: The owner of a curry house was found guilty of manslaughter by gross negligence, and other offenses, over a fatal dish of chicken tikka masala.

headline.main: British Restaurateur Sentenced to 6 Years After Peanut Allergy Death
headline.print_headline: 6-Year Prison Term in Peanut Allergy Death

snippet: The owner of a curry house was found guilty of manslaughter by gross negligence, and other offenses, over a fatal dish of chicken tikka masala.
